\ud83d\udd27 STRUCTURE & SYSTEMS.title: The Next Revolution
\ud83d\udd27 STRUCTURE & SYSTEMS.author: Murray Bookchin
\ud83d\udd27 STRUCTURE & SYSTEMS.blurb: Political theory meets direct democracy. He's the dad of Democratic Confederalism. Also a crusty anarchist who would definitely yell at NPR.

\ud83d\udd27 STRUCTURE & SYSTEMS.title: Re-enchanting the World
\ud83d\udd27 STRUCTURE & SYSTEMS.author: Silvia Federici
\ud83d\udd27 STRUCTURE & SYSTEMS.blurb: Deep dives into feminism, land, labor, and the witch hunts. Yes, those witch hunts. Connects history to modern struggles.

\ud83d\udd27 STRUCTURE & SYSTEMS.title: The Utopia of Rules
\ud83d\udd27 STRUCTURE & SYSTEMS.author: David Graeber
\ud83d\udd27 STRUCTURE & SYSTEMS.blurb: He exposes the absurdity of bureaucracy while making you laugh. The guy who wrote Bullshit Jobs and also co-founded Occupy Wall Street.

\ud83d\udd27 STRUCTURE & SYSTEMS.title: Governing the Commons
\ud83d\udd27 STRUCTURE & SYSTEMS.author: Elinor Ostrom
\ud83d\udd27 STRUCTURE & SYSTEMS.blurb: Won a Nobel Prize for showing how people can manage shared resources without ruining them—i.e. without billionaires.

\ud83c\udf31 ECOLOGY & ECONOMY.title: Doughnut Economics
\ud83c\udf31 ECOLOGY & ECONOMY.author: Kate Raworth
\ud83c\udf31 ECOLOGY & ECONOMY.blurb: It’s the closest we have to a post-capitalist economic model that works in PowerPoint and fairy tales.

\ud83c\udf31 ECOLOGY & ECONOMY.title: This Changes Everything
\ud83c\udf31 ECOLOGY & ECONOMY.author: Naomi Klein
\ud83c\udf31 ECOLOGY & ECONOMY.blurb: A spicy, accurate critique of capitalism as the root of climate collapse. Her books should come with matches.

\ud83c\udf31 ECOLOGY & ECONOMY.title: Less is More: How Degrowth Will Save the World
\ud83c\udf31 ECOLOGY & ECONOMY.author: Jason Hickel
\ud83c\udf31 ECOLOGY & ECONOMY.blurb: Capitalism’s growth obsession is killing us. Hickel says: downsize, redistribute, breathe.

\ud83e\udef1\ud83c\udffd\u200d\ud83e\ude.title: All About Love
\ud83e\udef1\ud83c\udffd\u200d\ud83e\ude.author: bell hooks
\ud83e\udef1\ud83c\udffd\u200d\ud83e\ude.blurb: Love as a political act. Community as rebellion. Would have been your kingdom’s Minister of Emotional Defense.

\ud83e\udef1\ud83c\udffd\u200d\ud83e\ude.title: Care Work: Dreaming Disability Justice
\ud83e\udef1\ud83c\udffd\u200d\ud83e\ude.author: Leah Lakshmi Piepzna-Samarasinha
\ud83e\udef1\ud83c\udffd\u200d\ud83e\ude.blurb: Critical for designing a world that doesn’t just include disabled people—it is built by and for them.

\ud83e\udef1\ud83c\udffd\u200d\ud83e\ude.title: Thick: And Other Essays
\ud83e\udef1\ud83c\udffd\u200d\ud83e\ude.author: Tressie McMillan Cottom
\ud83e\udef1\ud83c\udffd\u200d\ud83e\ude.blurb: Smart, sharp, and written with the kind of bite that tastes like justice. Class, race, beauty, power.

\ud83d\udd4a\ufe0f LIBERATION THEORY & P.title: Freedom Is a Constant Struggle
\ud83d\udd4a\ufe0f LIBERATION THEORY & P.author: Angela Davis
\ud83d\udd4a\ufe0f LIBERATION THEORY & P.blurb: Civil rights, Palestine, prison abolition, feminism. She’s the real-deal north star.

\ud83d\udd4a\ufe0f LIBERATION THEORY & P.title: Emergent Strategy
\ud83d\udd4a\ufe0f LIBERATION THEORY & P.author: adrienne maree brown
\ud83d\udd4a\ufe0f LIBERATION THEORY & P.blurb: A literal spellbook for organizing. Nature, change, science fiction, and softness as political power.

\ud83d\udd4a\ufe0f LIBERATION THEORY & P.title: Field Notes on Democracy
\ud83d\udd4a\ufe0f LIBERATION THEORY & P.author: Arundhati Roy
\ud83d\udd4a\ufe0f LIBERATION THEORY & P.blurb: She writes about India, but everything she says applies to our crumbling democratic farce.

\ud83d\udddd\ufe0f FABLE, CODE & CULTURE.title: Parable of the Sower
\ud83d\udddd\ufe0f FABLE, CODE & CULTURE.author: Octavia Butler
\ud83d\udddd\ufe0f FABLE, CODE & CULTURE.blurb: If you haven’t read it, it’s mandatory. If you have, read it again. It's prophecy in the form of fiction.

\ud83d\udddd\ufe0f FABLE, CODE & CULTURE.title: The Last Summer of Reason
\ud83d\udddd\ufe0f FABLE, CODE & CULTURE.author: Tahar Djaout
\ud83d\udddd\ufe0f FABLE, CODE & CULTURE.blurb: Because you brought it up. Because you are the bookstore owner. Because the soft resistance is how we remember ourselves.

\ud83d\udddd\ufe0f FABLE, CODE & CULTURE.title: How to Do Nothing: Resisting the Attention Economy
\ud83d\udddd\ufe0f FABLE, CODE & CULTURE.author: Jenny Odell
\ud83d\udddd\ufe0f FABLE, CODE & CULTURE.blurb: The manifesto of reclaiming time, meaning, and place in a world that wants to monetize your every blink.
